intro.description: TAK (Team Awareness Kit): A GPS-enabled platform for real-time tracking of friendly forces, sharing observations, and receiving command updates.
intro.title: TAK

tak-auto-import.description:
To connect to the server, just comlete the steps shown above, make sure ATAK opens a popup, press "yes" when prompted. 
 If ATAK did not open popup window, please try again.
tak-auto-import.title: Auto Import

tak-data-sync.description: You need to enable Data Sync plugin order for ATAK to work.
tak-data-sync.title: Data Sync

tak-download.description: Download the ATAK-CIV app from the Play Store and install it:
tak-download.title: Download

tak-home.description: Inside ATAK you have few options. Use the Messages tab for communication with your team. Feeds tab helps you follow traffic and events inside ATAK . Tap the Tools menu for more options including the Plugins tab. At the bottom you can see the Status of your current ATAK.
tak-home.title: ATAK tools

tak-manual-import.description: You can also manually import the configuration package
tak-manual-import.title: Manual Import

tak-plugins.description: You can find Plugins-tab from the Tools-menu.
tak-plugins.title: ATAK Plugins

wintak.description: Choose the platform you are using (1), if it isn't detected correctly. Download your package (2). Read the instructions for importing your package (3).

install.description: Remember to choose the platform you are using (1), if it isn't detected correctly. After downloading your package (2) and importing it you are ready to go!
install.title: Package Download

return.description: You can always re-open to this guide by pressing the button in the bottom right corner.
return.title: Opening guide

onboarding.completionDesc: You're all set and ready to operate at full capacity.

tak-download.description: Download the iTAK app from the App Store and install it:
tak-download.title: Download

tak-package.description: Check that your platform is set right. After that download your client package.
tak-package.title: Package download

itak-setup.description: Open up iTAK. When prompted for permission to access devices in local networks, don't allow it. ALLOW all other permissions. You should set up your callsign match the one inside Deploy App.
itak-setup.title: Setup iTAK

itak-settings.description: Settings can be accessed from the top right corner. There you can change the map and preferences. Recommended: Change units inside preferences to use MGRS and metric units.
itak-settings.title: Change settings

itak-import.description: Open the "Packages"-menu and add a new package from local device. Select the file you downloaded previously.
itak-import.title: Import the package

itak-sync1.description: Open the "Data Sync"-menu and subscribe to the "RECON"-feed.
itak-sync1.title: Data Sync (1/2)

itak-sync2.description: Go back to the "Data Sync"-menu and do a full sync.
itak-sync2.title: Data Sync (2/2)

onboarding.progressSaved: Your onboarding progress has been saved.
onboarding.title: Onboard to TAK

windows.completionDesc: You're all set and ready to operate at full capacity.
windows.progressSaved: Your onboarding progress has been saved.

health.description: See how everything's running at a glance. Check if your systems are healthy and your network is connected.
health.title: System Status

instructions.description: Need help getting started? Find step-by-step guides and tips for making the most of Modular Apps.
instructions.title: Help & Guides

invite.description: Bring new people onto your team with secure invite codes or QR codes. Share them however works best for you.
invite.title: Invite People

products.description: Launch the Team Awareness Kit and other apps you need. Everything's ready to go when you are.
products.title: Your Apps

users.description: See who's on your team, approve new members, and manage everyone's access. Keep things secure and organized.
users.title: Team Members

welcome.description: This is your home base for managing everything. Launch apps, check system status, and keep your team organized—all in one place.
welcome.title: Welcome!

windows.title: Onboard to Deploy App

open_atak_dialog.description: Click the button below to open in ATAK
open_atak_dialog.note: When ATAK opens and asks about importing a package with a long link, choose "Yes"
open_atak_dialog.open: Open ATAK and connect to service
open_atak_dialog.title: ATAK Mission Package Auto Import

phase1.step1_desc_civ: Download the ATAK-CIV app from the Play Store and install it:
phase1.step1_desc_sync: Download the ATAK Data Sync-plugin and install it:
phase1.step2_desc_error: If the application gives an error message, select "Wait".
phase1.step2_desc_permissions: Open the app and grant all requested permissions.
phase1.step2_title: Open the ATAK app and grant permissions

phase2.step1_desc_1: When opening the TAK app for the first time, the TAK Device Setup appears.
phase2.step1_desc_3: The Select Data Package menu will open.
phase2.step1_title: 1. Open the Select Data Package menu
phase2.step2_desc_1: Locate the folder where you downloaded your Client Package file <bold>'Name.zip'</bold>.
phase2.step2_desc_2: Tip: Press <bold>Date</bold> to see the most recently downloaded file, likely your client package.
phase2.step2_title: 2. Find and select the message base zip
phase2.step3_desc_2: You will receive several notifications about the loading of configuration files.
phase2.step3_desc_4: Check the bottom right corner to confirm your server connection is activated (green light).

phase3.step1_desc_1: Press the three lines (hamburger icon) in the top right corner.
phase3.step1_desc_2: Scroll to the bottom of the menu and select <bold>Settings</bold>.
phase3.step2_desc_1: Select <bold>My Team</bold> and choose the color you were instructed to use.
phase3.step2_desc_2: Select <bold>My Role</bold>. Unless otherwise specified by your superiors, all command post users should use the <bold>Team Member</bold> role.
phase3.step2_desc_3: Your role and team are now set.

phase4.step1_desc_1: a. In the main view, open the hamburger menu and find <bold>Plugins</bold>. (You must have the Data Sync plugin installed from Google Play.)
phase4.step1_desc_2: b. The Plugins menu opens. Press on the line for <bold>Data Sync</bold> where it says <bold>"Status: Not loaded."</bold>
phase4.step1_desc_3: c. The app asks if you want to load Data Sync. Press <bold>Load</bold>.
phase4.step1_desc_4: d. The status of Data Sync changes to <bold>Loaded</bold>.
phase4.step1_desc_5: Ready! You can exit the menu.
phase4.step2_desc_1: In the main view, open the hamburger menu and select <bold>Data Sync</bold>.
phase4.step2_desc_2: Opening the Data Sync menu reveals feeds available from the server.
phase4.step2_desc_3: Select the feed(s) you've been instructed to subscribe to (example: <bold>RECON</bold>).
phase4.step2_desc_4: From the popup window, select <bold>Download & Sync</bold>.
phase4.step2_desc_5: Recon Feed is now enabled. You will receive markers on your map from the command post.
phase4.step3_desc_1: Ensure <bold>Auto Download</bold> is on. Return to the main view and open the hamburger menu.
phase4.step3_desc_3: Find the <bold>Auto Download Updates</bold> setting and ensure it is turned on.
phase4.step3_desc_4: This ensures ATAK automatically downloads updates for your subscribed feeds.

phase5.step1_desc_1: To select a map base, open <bold>Maps</bold> from the toolbar (top right corner).
phase5.step1_desc_2: Acknowledge a few notifications by pressing <bold>OK</bold>.
phase5.step1_desc_3: Choose the <bold>Mobile</bold> tab and activate the <bold>02 Google Hybrid</bold> map base.
phase5.step1_desc_4: Exit the menu by pressing the <bold>Back</bold> button a few times.
phase5.step2_desc_1: In ATAK, unit settings are usually preconfigured by your installed Client Package. Check or adjust them as follows:
phase5.step2_desc_2_6: Select <bold>Speed Units</bold> and choose <bold>KM per Hour (kmph)</bold>.
phase5.step2_desc_2_7: Scroll to <bold>UNIT THRESHOLD</bold>, select <bold>Meters to Kilometers</bold>, set to <bold>1000</bold>, and press <bold>OK</bold>.
phase5.step2_desc_3: Units are now set. Exit the menu by pressing the back button several times.
phase5.step3_desc_1: Your callsign is usually set by your installed Client Package. To change it:
phase5.step3_title: 3. Check and change the Callsign if necessary

android.step3_done: Done, ATAK is ready to use.
android.title: ATAK Package Installation

phase1.step1_desc_1: Download the iTAK app from the App Store and install it.
phase1.step1_desc_2: Press the button below to get the app.
phase1.step2_desc_1: Download your client package by pressing the green button below.
phase1.step2_desc_2: You can also find the same button on the front page.
phase1.zip_file_warning: NOTE! The zip file does not need to be extracted!

phase2.step1_desc_2: When the application asks: "iTAK wants to find and connect to devices on your local network...", choose Don't Allow.
phase2.step2_desc_2: Enter your alias in the Callsign field, for example, Rambo. Do not fill the Phone field. Finally, press Next.
phase2.step3_desc_2:
In the Select Team field, choose your team's (as you should have been ordered to) color from the dropdown menu. In the Select Team Role field, choose the role Team Member, unless otherwise instructed.
Command post users will set their role to HQ.
Finally, press Next.
phase2.step4_desc_1: a. Set Privacy Settings to allow notifications and location services.
phase2.step4_desc_2: iOS will then ask if you allow iTAK to send you notifications and use your location. Choose Allow for notifications.
phase2.step4_desc_3: Choose Allow While Using the App for location.
phase2.step4_desc_4: After this, move on to establish the server connection with your Client Package.
phase2.step4_title: Grant the necessary permissions to the application

phase3.step1_desc_1: a. Go to the map view and scroll the toolbar to the right until you find the Package icon.
phase3.step1_important: Important! Do not attempt to install the Client Package via iTAK Settings->Network->Server!. That won't work.
phase3.step2_desc_1: b. The Packages menu opens, it will be empty. Press the plus icon in the bottom right to add your message template package.
phase3.step2_desc_3: d. Select your package. It will be a zip file named YourCallsign.zip.
phase3.step2_desc_4: e. As a sign of success, the Packages menu list will show the server's callsign and a green light. Return to the map view.
phase3.step2_desc_5: The server connection is now established. As a sign, the bottom right of the map will display in green Connected.
phase3.step2_title: Add your message template package to iTAK

phase4.step1_desc_1: a. Open Settings again from the gear icon in the top left corner.
phase4.step1_desc_2: b. Select Preferences from the main Settings menu.
phase4.step1_desc_3: Prepare to set the correct units of measure and coordinate system.
phase4.step2_desc_2: Select MGRS for Coordinate Format and Meters for Distance Format.
phase4.step3_desc_1: a. If you want to change the map source, select Map Source from the main Settings menu.
phase4.step3_desc_2: b. Choose your desired map source. Note! Availability may vary.
phase4.step3_desc_3:
Great! You have now set up iTAK for use.
If you need to edit your callsign, you can do so from the Settings menu by clicking your callsign.

phase5.step1_desc_1: In the main view, open the tool menu (at the bottom) and scroll to the right to find the Data Sync menu.
phase5.step2_desc_1: In the Data Sync menu, press the Subscribe button.
phase5.step2_desc_2: Select the available server (Your deployment's name should appear, such as 'positive-beetle.').
phase5.step2_desc_3: In the upcoming view, select the RECON feed & any other Feed you've been ordered to subscribe.
phase5.step3_desc_1: Starting from now, the Recon Feed created and updated by your Command Post users is at your disposal.
phase5.step3_desc_2: The feed will appear in your Data Sync menu. Instructions for using the feed are in the Using in the group instructions.

ios.step3_done: Done, ITAK is ready to use.
ios.title: ITAK Package Installation

tracker.step3_done: Done, TAK Tracker is ready to use.
tracker.title: TAK Tracker Package Installation

phase1.step1_desc_1: WinTAK requires the workstation's language to be English and the region setting United States.
phase1.step1_desc_2: Before installing the application, search for Time and Language from the search bar (bottom left).
phase1.step1_desc_3: First, let's change the region setting. Select Region from the sidebar in Time and Language menu.
phase1.step1_desc_4: Select United States for the country or region. Ensure that the regional format is also set to English (United States).
phase1.step1_title: 1. Set your Region to United States
phase1.step2_desc_1: From the sidebar in the Time and Language menu, select Language.
phase1.step2_desc_2: Set the Windows display language to English (United States).
phase1.step2_desc_3: Finalize changing the display language by signing out and signing back in.
phase1.step3_desc_1: If English is not available in the display language options, press Add a language and search for it.
phase1.step3_desc_2: Press Install language pack. Wait for the language pack to install.
phase1.step3_desc_3: Afterward, you can select English as the display language as described in step 2.
phase1.step3_desc_4: The language settings are now complete.

phase2.step1_desc_1: Download the WinTAK application from the Defense Forces' designated location.
phase2.step1_desc_2: Important! Only download Windows applications from the instructed location.
phase2.step3_desc_1: Find the downloaded zip and extract it. Locate the .msi installation file inside the zip's Products folder.
phase2.step3_desc_2: Double-click the .msi file to open the installer.
phase2.step4_desc_1: Install WinTAK using the Setup Wizard.
phase2.step4_desc_2: Press Next. Choose the application installation folder.
phase2.step4_desc_3: Optionally change the installation folder via the Browse button. Press Next.
phase2.step4_desc_4: Select the components to install in the Setup Wizard. Select at least the following component: Data Sync.
phase2.step4_desc_5: Press Next. The Wizard is ready to start the installation, press Install.

phase3.step1_desc: Open the WinTAK application from the desktop.
phase3.step2_desc_1: After a moment, the Device Setup Wizard will open.
phase3.step2_desc_2: As its first step, accept the EULA.
phase3.step3_desc_2: a. The application will ask if you want to import a data package.
phase3.step3_desc_3: b. Select 'Yes'. Point to the Client Package.
phase3.step3_desc_4: Once you have chosen the package and pressed Open, the Select Import Strategy window will open.
phase3.step4_desc_1: With the message foundation package, various map bases may come.
phase3.step5_desc_1: The Device Setup Wizard will ask if you want to define your callsign.
phase3.step5_desc_2: These are not needed, clear the boxes and press OK.
phase3.step6_desc_1: The application will ask if plugins should be installed.
phase3.step6_desc_2: Next, the application will ask if DTED-0 elevation models should be downloaded automatically.
phase3.step7_desc_1: Now the basic settings of WinTAK have been made. Let's check 'My Preferences.'
phase3.step7_desc_2: Also, check the TAK Network Status. A green cloud means the server connection is OK, red means it is disconnected.

phase4.step1_desc_2: Press the three stacked lines, the hamburger menu, in the top left corner.
phase4.step1_desc_5: The Display Preferences menu opens. Select Unit Display Format Preferences.
phase4.step1_desc_6: Check that the settings are as shown in the picture. Change if necessary.

windows.step1_note: WinTAK uses the same package as ATAK
windows.step3_done: Done, WinTAK is ready to use.
windows.title: WinTAK Package Installation

wizard_title.phase1: Set your Windows PC's Language to English
